Compulsory education

In Spain, all foreigners under the age of 16 have the full right to access the compulsory education of the educational system. In such a way that they can access scholarships and grants and obtain the corresponding academic degree under the same conditions as Spaniards.
 The right to basic education is guaranteed regardless of the legal status of the family. Whether the parents are in an irregular situation, as if they are refugees or meet the requirements to be residents, the sons or daughters must also attend school. https://web.gencat.cat/es/temes/educacio/index.html
 If you are over 18 years old and wish to obtain the title of Graduate in Compulsory Secondary Education, you can take the test to directly obtain the title https://educacio.gencat.cat/ca/serveis-tramits/proves/proves-lliures-obtencio-titols/obtencio-geso- month-18-anys/

Post-compulsory education

 All foreign minors and resident foreigners over 18 years of age have the right to access post-compulsory educational stages, obtain the corresponding qualifications and scholarships and grants under the same conditions as Spaniards.
 Therefore, if you are a migrant or refugee and wish to continue your post-compulsory education outside your country of origin, you can access any level of the Spanish education system, provided you meet the academic access requirements. Depending on your previous training and your academic goals, in post-compulsory education there are different training options from which you can choose https://web.gencat.cat/es/temes/educacio/index.html

Where can I get food?

 The main source of supply is the Food Bank (https://www.bancdelsaliments.org/es/ayuda-alimentaria), but there are also religious organizations and associations that fulfill the same function. You may also be interested in obtaining a Money Card that facilitates Social Services, the management of financial aid for food, as well as the access of families to fresh food and other basic products https://www.diba.cat/es/web/benestar/targeta-moneder
 These are the nearest food aid centers: http://www.l-h.cat/serveisocials/262731_1.aspx?id=1 Mare de Déu de Bellvitge Parish: https://www.fundaciolavinya.org/es/que-fem/projecte/banc-daliments https://caritas.barcelona/en/needed-help/

Where can I eat?

 Dining room for the elderly: https://www.papelea.com/ayuntamiento -de-hospitalet-de-llobregat/canteen-for-elderly-people Restaurant and Social Menjador "La Terrasseta" Carrer de la Fraternitat, 40, 08012 Barcelona 934 15 62 98
 Where can my children eat?

 Children can access the soup kitchens accompanied by their parents. Also, if they are in school they can eat in the school canteen. With a canteen scholarship you can reduce your cost and be able to be fully covered. 
Application for a canteen scholarship: https://www.edubcn.cat/es/alumnado_y_familia /aid_scholarships_and_subsidies/aid_for_school_dining_room
